snippet: Voters in an Okinawan city re-elected a mayor who promised to block construction of a replacement site for the United States base.
abstract: Efforts to relocate Marine air base on Okinawa, Japan, encounters setback when voters in town of Nago reelect Susumu Inamine, leftist mayor who promised to block construction of replacement site; victory deals blow to Japanese Prime Min Shinzo Abe, who has invested political capital in restarting stalled relocation deal and building ties with United States.
lead_paragraph: Voters in an Okinawan city re-elected a mayor who promised to block construction of a replacement site for the United States base.

headline.main: In a City on Okinawa, Mayor’s Re-election Deals a Blow to Marine Base Relocation Plan
headline.print_headline: In a City on Okinawa, Mayor’s Re-election Deals a Blow to Marine Base Relocation Plan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
